meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Let's get this review party started!

Paper Trail is the kind of game that will make you fold, unfold, and refold your expectations (see what I did there?). At its core, it's a top-down puzzle game about paper folding, and I'm here for it! The unique mechanic has just enough intricacy to keep me engaged without making me feel like a crumpled up piece of paper.

Now, let's take a stroll down review lane. Metro GameCentral gave it a 70, saying it's "charmingly illustrated" with a "perspective-shifting puzzle game." That sounds about right – I mean, who doesn't love a good fold? Push Square echoed the sentiment, giving it an 80 and praising its unique puzzle mechanic. Playful, right?

But don't worry, folks; not everyone's a fan of this folded paper trail. GameSpew gave it a 70, saying the puzzles can be "tiresome" and that some players might struggle to digest more than a couple of levels at a time. That's fair – even I got a little frustrated when my folds didn't quite turn out as planned.

On the other hand, some critics went full-on Origami-geddon! PlayStation Universe gave it a 95, calling it "a game that sets out to do so with a clear passion and mastery of craft." That's high praise indeed – almost as high as GAMINGbible's 90, which called Paper Trail "a simple story told via... the art of virtual origami" (see what they did there?).

All in all, I'm hooked on this paper trail! With its beautiful hand-drawn art, addictive puzzle mechanic, and whimsical world, it's a must-play for anyone looking to fold their way into some fun.

Now, if you'll excuse me, I need to go fold some more papers.
